result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey John Saas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 17CF380.
Defendant to report to Probation today September 11, 2018.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 17CF380

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: John A Kucinski, DF:Jeffrey John Saas appeared.  Court called.  Set for STC.  Includes case 16TR1101, 16TR1626, 16TR1627, 15CF577, 16CF85, 17CF208, 17CF380, 17CF709, 18CF13 18CF503 & 18CF521.  There is an agreement.  Crt orally reviews the plea questionnaire and informs the DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads No Contest to Ct 1 & Ct. 8 with the Domestic Abuse Enhancer Stricken in 17CF380.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 in 15CF577 to misdemeanor battery 940.19(1).  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads No Contest to the amended Ct 1 with the Domestic Abuse Enhancer Stricken in 15CF577.  Court questions the DE.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct. 1 in 16TR1626.   Crt accepts pleas, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 & Ct. 8 with the Domestic Abuse Enhancer Stricken in 17CF380 & guilty of the amended Ct. 1 in 15CF577 with the Domestic Abuse Enhancer Stricken and guilty of Ct. 1 in 16TR1626. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses 16TR1101, 16TR1627, 16CF85, 17CF709, 18CF13, 18CF503, 18CF521 & Ct. 1, Ct. 2, Ct. 3, Ct. 4, Ct. 5 & Ct. 6 in 17CF208 & Ct. 2, Ct. 3, Ct. 4, Ct. 5 & Ct. 6 in 17CF380. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 on 16TR1626
Costs of $987.50 apply money on file and remainin balance add to payment plan
8 month driver's license revocation
8 month IID
AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment

Amended Ct. 1 in 15CF577 to run concurrent with Ct. 1 and Ct. 8 in 17CF380
- S/W 2 years probation with conditions
- AODA if recommended by the agent
- 68 days conditional time Imposed and stayed with credit for 22 days
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- DE to have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Angela Webber.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  
- DE to write an apology letter to Cheryl Keller within 30 days to be given to the probation agent 
- DE to report to probation today 09/11/18 
- Bail remains in effect until DE signs up for probation and then is vacated
- Court waives all costs and surcharges except for one set in the amount of $268.00 and 250.00 for the surcharge to be paid through probation
- 20 days to appeal
Status conference on September 11, 2018 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 7, 2018 at 09:00 am.

Filed by ADA McKinley. Requesting a continuance of 9/11/2018 JT. km

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: John A Kucinski, DF: Jeffrey John Saas appeared.  Court called.  Includes case16TR1101, 16TR1626, 16TR1627, 15CF577, 16CF85, 17CF709 & 18CF13. 17CF380 & 17CF208 (Plea/Sentencing).  There is an agreement.  Crt orally reviews the plea questionnaire and informs the DE of his rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads No Contest to Ct 7 in 17CF208 & Ct. 7 in 17CF380 with the domestic abuse enhancer. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 7 in 17CF208 & Ct. 7 in 17CF380 with the domestic abuse enhancer. On motion of the State without objection all the other remaining counts in 17CF208 and in 17CF380 will remain.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 7 in 17CF208 & Ct. 7 in 17CF380 with the domestic abuse enhancer to run concurrent to each other
W/S 2 years probation with conditions
- DE sentenced to 7 days in the St. Croix County Jail credit for 7 days served
- Domestic Abuse Evaluation and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- AODA and follow through with recommended therapy or treatment
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- Letter of apology to the Officer Welbourn
- DE to have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Angela Weber.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent. 
- Court will assess only one set of costs and one DNA surcharg.  Court costs of $243.00 and $200.00 for the DNA surcharge and $100.00 for the Domestic Abuse Assessment 
- Apply money on file for all costs and if a remaining balance it is to be paid through probation
- DE to report to the DRC to provide a DNA sample
- DE to report to probation today 03/08/18
- 20 days to appeal

Bail is modified on all files 15CF577, 16CF85, 17CF208, 17CF380, 17CF709 & 18CF13 to a $2,500 signature, AS & NAC.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2018 at 10:00 am.

*AMENDED*

INCLUDES 15CF577, 16CF85, 17CF208, 17CF380, 17CF709 & 18CF13

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Angela Weber.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Jeffrey John Saas appeared.  Court called at 2:26 p.m.  Set for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing at 01-07-2016 02:00 pm

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Angela W.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
